comments:
Driver:  WTP0.7 RC5

I ran into the problem with RC2 as well but Rupam was not able to reproduce it 
on RC3.  I tried again with RC5 and the problem is still there.

In a new workspace, go through creating Web service bottom-up using Tomcat 4.1 
server and you'll get:

At that time, if you exit the Web service wizard and tried starting the Tomcat 
4.1 server, you'll have the same problem with starting.  However, if you create 
a Tomcat 4.1 server and then run the Web service wizard, the server would start 
fine.

Kathy,

I still can't reproduce this. If you are still seeing it consistently in M9, perhaps I can invesigate this on your machine.

Thanks,
Rupam

Created an attachment (id=30843)
SimpleDVDStore

SimpleDVDStore source from article "Eclipsing Axis!" in the eclipse-magazin 4/05, written by Marc Teufel.

The Configuration is : Eclipse 3.1.0, JDK 1.4.2, Tomcat 5.5
The java source / bean-file I used is attached to this post.

Hi Kathy,

This is another one of those that I can't seem to reproduce. If you're still seeing this in the latest driver, let me know and we can look at it further on your machine.

BTW, comment #4 from Sascha Kuemmel looks like a different problem altogether related to the server's configuration.

Thanks.

With the RC1 12/02 00:59 driver, I can no longer reproduce the problem.  The Web modules was automatically added to the Tomcat 4.1 server the Web services wizard created.  So that problem can be closed.

However, I did see the problem in comment #4 once with the RC1 driver when running through Web service scenario.  For some reason 2 servers was created then.  Let's use this defect to track that problem.

By CC:  Sascha, were you able to reproduce the problem consistently?

Sascha,
The attached file looks like a Session EJB. WTP currently does not support creating Web services from Session EJBs for Axis. Could you please provide steps to reproduce the problem.

Kathy,
You mentioned that you've seen this as well. Could you please describe the scenario you were running?

Thanks.

Haven't heard anything from originator(s) in over three weeks so resolving. Please reopen with a description of the scenario if you're still seeing this.

Thanks.

traces.message: Server Tomcat v4.1 Server @  localhost failed to start.
Two or more Web modules defined in the configuration have the same context root (/SimpleDVDStore). To start this server you will need to remove the duplicate(s).
